result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taleia R Roberts

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Taleia R Roberts appeared by video.  Attorney Jason Canfield appeared by video for Taleia R Roberts.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are requesting a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing date. Case is adjourned  to 11-8-22 at 8:30 am for a DPA by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Taleia R Roberts appeared by video.  Attorney Jason Canfield in court for Taleia R Roberts.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Taleia R Roberts in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Attorney Canfield was recently appointed and is requesting a preliminary hearing date. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 10. This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed. Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Taleia R Roberts in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Case in court for a status conference.  No attorney has been appointed yet.  Case is adjourned to 8-16-22 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant Taleia R Roberts in court.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant can have contact AS PERMITTED PURSUANT TO ANY CHILDRENS COURT OR DMCPS ORDERS otherwise no contact is permitted.

Defendant Taleia R Roberts in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 10.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/09/2022@230p
